history.content:
Sorry for the repost, but we are looking for a few more EECS instructors to join for Fall 2019 as our class largely consists of incoming EECS students. I was an instructor last Fall and I found it a great experience to pass on advice to the incoming freshman class. In terms of time commitment, you simply have to meet with your section (consisting of 15-20 students) once a week for 1 hour. Lesson plans are already pre-made so no content creation is necessary. 

Original Post: 

Want to share your knowledge of navigating the world of Berkeley engineering with incoming students? Become an instructor for Engineering 98 for the Fall 2019 semester! Engineering 98 is a one unit, P/NP DeCal class that was designed by upper division engineering students to help freshmen get the most out of Berkeley engineering. And being an instructor is a great opportunity to get teaching experience, build communication skills, and get involved with engineering students on campus. If you’re interested, please fill out this form (https://tinyurl.com/e98f19) by THIS Friday May 3rd at 11:59 PM. More information about the course is also included in the form.

 

If you have any questions, please contact the E98 Coordinators at e98coords@gmail.com!
history.subject: E98 Instructor Application due Tomorrow
